tongue
You like to have lots of fun, wether it be with friends havin a good time or sexually, u like extra things to make it more pleasurable

<font size="6"><font color="#ffff00">H</font><font color="#cc99ff">A</font><font color="#ffcc00">P</font><font color="#ccffcc">P</font><font color="#ff99cc">Y</font> <font color="#99ccff">E</font><font color="#ffff00">A</font><font color="#cc99ff">S</font><font color="#ffcc00">T</font><font color="#ccffcc">E</font><font color="#ff99cc">R</font><font color="#99ccff">!</font></font>

Friday we went grocery shopping, Saturday we went to his mom's and had Easter pictures taken of all the kids, today we finished grocery shopping and went to walmart.

Of course we bought more movies cause we are weak when it comes to DVD's. lol 

I bought Rhiannonininininin Quest for Camelot for Easter.  She was thrilled so I'm happy about that.

We bought Crocodile Dundee 1 and 2, Grumpier Old Men, Lake Placid, My Fellow Americans, National Lampoon's Vacation, Nine Months, Nothing but Trouble, Police Academy and Spanglish.  Ok, we didn't buy all of them today at Walmart but most of them.  Also got two at Pop Video.  But still, we got them.  Also got the kid's their easter baskets of goodies and a stand to put our DVD's on. 

DJ starts softball this week.  We got her a glove.  Both kids also got a new pair of shoes. 

Saw Narnia too this weekend.  I will own it.  It's FANTASTIC!!  Could have something to do with the fact that I'm probably unhealthily obsessed with it but it is really good.  I will own it and the box set of the books one day!

Anyway, I'm tuckered out from all the running we did this weekend. 

Can't wait till the 22nd and the 23rd!  Enjoy your evenings!

Figured I'd take a break from writing to refresh my mind a little.  Nothing too new to report though.  George finally went back to work.  I've noticed a considerable lift in his spirits in the week since we started.  It's a physical job though and his mom said he isn't too thrilled about that.  He's looking to get an efficiency apartment as soon as he gets paid.  I tried telling him that he should just get a one bedroom.  They don't cost much different and at least that way you don't have to take the huge chance of sharing a bathroom with someone else.  Ewww.  Plus I don't want my kid sharing a bathroom with others that we dont' know.  You don't know what they have or don't have.  
Anyway, guess that's it.  My men are sleeping and DJ is in school and now I have a block on my story.  Just my luck huh?  Maybe I'll call someone to take my mind off of it for a little bit then try again.  Maybe not.  I don't know but in any case, I have to do something else, take my mind off of it so I can sit down and start fresh again in a little bit.

Last night was fun.  I drank a bottle of rum (so we know why the rum is gone this time) and giggled and sang alot.  I also had many issues with my speech but it's ok cause I also discovered that I speak frog fluently.

Hey Anannin, we are trafficing air control!  

Yes well, I'm extremely tired because I didn't get to be till about 3-ish...probably later once I ate my sub.  Then was up about 7.  A must do again.  Got through two chapters in The Stand so far today.  It's gonna take me longer than I'd like but I'll get through it eventually.  First I have to catch up on my sleep! lol  

Can't wait for this weekend.  Anannin, give me a list you've made for things you want.  If I don't do you birthday shopping this weekend then it will be soon.  I figured you might just have the book I saw that I wanted to get for you so if you send me one of you lists (amazon or whatever) then at least that way I would know what you would be really happy with.

This is Garfuary signing off.......

Yesterday, we went back to Reading to get my money back from Toys R Us.  Then went to Michael's.....where Rhiannon and I fell in love.  We will be returning to Reading in the future for girl fun which will include returns to both of those stores *winks at Rhiannon*

Once back in Pine Grove we chased Jeff down the road but he lost us then we went back to our house and laughed alot at our own retardedness.  Some stuff just never gets old does it? lol

Today started interestingly to say the least.  Found out people never get smarter and some get worse.  And the more I thought about all 4 things today, the more annoyed I got at all of them.  Two of them are about to make my head implode but hey....it's ok cause I know that I'm a better person for not being like them and not being around them as much as possible.

I guess that's it.  I don't know.  Not much detail in all this but no one wants to read that anyway most likely.

dragonsgrl spent the night Friday and we had lots of movie quoting giggling issues.  The Yesterday morning we went to the Country Squire for breakfast, ran over to the auction, then decided to run away to Reading for the day.  There we went shopping at Toys R Us for Mad Gab and one of those pop tents for the kids to play in.  We need to go replace it though because the tag on the shelf was not what they charged me.  Anyway, Then we decided to walk around the mall.  
I used to have this perfume (Aspen for Women) and no one sells it anymore and you can't even find it on their website........I found a perfume place in the Bershire Mall that sells it!!!!!!!  I was all kinds of happy from that.  And the best part is they sell it cheap, so I got two bottles.  
Then we went into Spensers.  I found an Amy Brown pin so it was mine, no questions asked, and dragonsgrl found one.......so suits her.  
After that, we went to the Old Country Buffet to eat.  Very yummy and dragonsgrl had never been there.  Actually she wasn't at the Country Squire before either....go us.
Was a fun day, hope we get to do it again soon.  Two more weeks if desired. lol  
Not sure exactly why Budda was all about telling me to buy things this week but it seemes like he was trying to spoil me a bit.  He didn't think about any of it, he just told me to either get it or picked it up himself.  It's so cute when he tries to spoil me cause he tries to do it in a tough guy, unnoticable way but c'mon now......like I can't tell when he's doing it.  I noticed it Friday night already.  He's so cute sometimes lolol
Ok, Billy is watching Lady and the Tramp so I'm off to tidy up a bit.

So we got half of our grocery shopping done today...doing the other half tomorrow. Got some movies and a few odds and ends at Wal*Mart.

These are the movies we got.... 

               

        

And we rented North Country...



Tomorrow we might be buying two more but we aren't sure yet.  
Anyway, I finally figured out what I want to get Bu for his birthday.  I'm putting a couple dollars away every pay to get it.  I can't wait to give it to him!  
Everyone have a good one!

<font color="#339966">Well tomorrow is payday and there will be another day or two of running around. Grocery shopping for one (which usually requires 2-3 different stores). There are only three bills to pay then it's off to Wal*Mart again. We should just move in there lol Hey did you know they had a bomb threat last week?! No one was allowed in for quite a few hours. Anyway, back to our plans. At Wal*Mart we need to pay on the layaway, buy a new bed sheet, a universal remote for the TV and who knows what else. Maybe a new game again? Or another 2/11 DVD deal? We will see.....</font>

LifeTouch is the company that takes pictures of the kids for school....all I'm gonna say is that they SUCK! Pictures aren't bad,which is about all they got right, but they still suck....lets not get into why.

In other news, we've been planning to move..........far away.........but we weren't sure where or when other than it was going to be this summer before DJ had to start school again.  Well today was some good news.  Bu got a job offer which requires relocation.  Money is as good as what he gets now or better...he isn't quite sure yet which but it won't be less.  How sweet is that?!

Lady and the Tramp is such a cute movie. I almost forgot how much I used to like it as a kid. I didn't get to watch a whole lot of it because I was chasing a small bunch of rug rats around while the older kids watched it. Everyone seemed to have tons of fun and the parents loved how original the idea of having it at the theatre was. The kids loved the Bratz cake and the fact that they got to pick between 5 different sodas! lol
She got some really neat gifts. I have to make the Thank You cards now for the kids in her class that came. She also exchanged phone numbers and now has little friends calling after school! lolol
Thanks to Rhiannoninininin for helping me do the cake and soda! Much appreciated sweetie. Everyone had a good time so I would definately call that a success. Yay!
All in all it was a good experience. Renee...I almost walked over to invite you cause it was then that I realized I never asked you to come! I'm so sorry! You can come kick me in the tush for that. I also forgot to invite my cousin and her daughter so your not the only one but I'm still sorry. Didn't do that intentionally.
And, last but not least, Rhiannon came over afterwards and kicked my a$$ in both Phase 10 (which she never played before) and UNO. I want a rematch! lol She beat me bad...was fun. 2 a.m. came before we realized it and then the thing that went bump on the porch nearly made her stay the night. lol

Great times this weekend. Hope everyone enjoyed theirs as well!

Left and right
Like day and night
That's what makes the world go round
In and out
Thin and stout
That's what makes the world go round

For every up there is a down
For every square there is a round
For every high there is a low
For every to there is a fro
To and fro
Stop and go
That's what makes the world go round

You must set your sights upon the heights
Don't be a mediocrity
Don't just wait and trust to fate
And say, that's how it's meant to be
It's up to you how far you go
If you don't try you'll never know
And so my lad as I've explained
Nothing ventured, nothing gained

You see my boy it's nature's way
Upon the weak the strong ones prey
The human life it's also true
The strong will try to conquer you
That is what you must expect
Unless you use your intellect
Brains and brawn, weak and strong
That's what makes the world go round

I have all the name tags of those that let me know they would be at the party....done!! 

Also, someone FINALLY used her gift registry.  Heather got her the Simpson's Operation game.  That will prove to be interesting to play with her. lol  I was hoping someone would get her the Guess Who game but any game will make her happy.  I was also hoping someone would get her the Never Ending Story DVD which is soooo cheap at Wal*Mart but again.....she will enjoy herself no matter what. 

Well I guess that's it from my little neck of the woods. 

Again, Happy St. Patrick's Day all!  Hope it's a good, safe one.  Drink a green one for me! lol

Tomorrow I have my "annual". I don't wanna. And not that any of you really wanted to know that but all you women understand why I need to vent a little. All I can say is that I'm praying for plastic instead of metal! lmao

I only have 2 more name tags to make for the popcorn bags. Yes, I still haven't gotten them done! I'll probably do them tonight or tomorrow. I don't really have too many other options left! It's this weekend already! I can't believe she is six already!

DJ got a call about 6 this evening from her little friend Ashley at school. At first I got on the phone (Bu answered) and asked who it was because Bu didn't know. I heard her mom in the background say "Is that Destyni's mommy?" She said yes and her mom (who I know in a round about way) told her to ask me if she could still come to the party because she forgot to call. I said yes.

Then I told her that she could talk to her but not long because DJ was in trouble. After 5 minutes of giggling and not really talking, I asked DJ to tell her that she couldn't talk anymore tonight and ask if I could talk to her mommy. Then I told her mom that Ashley (who is a girl DJ talks about ALL the time) can call anytime she wants to talk to her....after her birthday party, because she is kind of grounded till then. After that though no problem. Then we discussed the party. I'm glad that at least one of the girls she talks about all the time will be coming.

I also made the name tags today for the bags of popcorn, however, now I have to make another one for Ashley lol I don't really like the way I did the ones I made already anyway so I think I'm gonna remake them. Then again maybe not. All I did was cut rectangles out of colored paper, punched a hole in the end and wrote their names. I can do better than that. And it isn't because I want them to look super for everyone else, I just know personally that I can do better. Sort of like a personal challenge I guess.

Yes well. I guess I'll have go start plotting how I'm going to go spice up the name tags. G'nite.

Another parent called today asking if it was ok to still R.S.V.P.  Since the teacher seemed to mess things up a bit I said sure.  That brings it to abour 9 kids including DJ.  Still small and enjoyable. 

Anyway, I was doing Matt's myspace today and decided it was time to redo mine because I saw something I really liked while looking for something for his......Let me know what you think of my new profile page and blog.  I like it alot...hope you all do too!

*kiss noise*

Today was just a whole lot of running around again.  We started at Renninger's Auction.  Then went up to the Frackville Mall.  While there, we stopped in a couple places.  K*Mart, the wine place where we got blueberry and cherry wine, EB where Bu got Madden 2006, K*B*Toys, Waldenbooks, then we left.  Went to McDonald's for lunch and stopped at Big Lots where we got a few little things (something for billy with numbers and letters, new lunch box for Bu) then back to Wal*Mart.  At Wal*Mart we bought Uno and Sonic mega collection for PS2....it has ALL the sonic games on it!!!  Then we put some stuff on layaway. 

Was a good day.  It isn't often we get to go do stuff and it sounds like we spent a ton but we didn't really and besides, even if we did.....we never do and once in a while it feels good to be able to do it, so we did it. lol  On the way home from Wal*mart we stopped at Dunkin Doughnuts. 

Now we are home and that's the most excitement we will have till DJ's party and next pay. lol

Today when Bu got home from work we went and cashed his check, paid the bills, then went to Giant.  So far we got the popcorn to pop for DJ's party....which reminds me, another parent called today to R.S.V.P. today.  Then at Giant we ran into one of the girls and her parents that DJ is always talking about.  She is sooo adorable and cheerful.  I think it made DJ's night to see her outside of school.  She isn't one that called yet about the party but I wasn't going to say anything because if they don't want to come or can't then it would have been very uncomfortable for them and I don't want to do that.

Afterwards we went to Pop Video to rend some movies but only ended up renting one...however, we bought two which brings our DVD count up to 101.  We have DVD issues. lol  Most of our movies however were out of the 2 for 11 bin at Wal*Mart so it isn't like we spend all our money on them and we've been slowly adding for 4 years now.  I don't think that's too bad.  If we had gotten that many at top price in the past year or something then I'd sit and wonder a little.

The movies we got are

and .....

Going to walmart tomorrow to check out the bargain bin of movies and to get goody bags to put the popcorn in for DJ's party.  Don't think we will be getting anything else there.  You never know though.  I'm going to try and keep his spending down a bit....yes you heard me, HIS spending.  Believe it or not, it's not me (the woman) who has a problem with spending.  If I do have any shopping issues it's usually on the children.  But isn't that typical of a mom?

Anyway, it was a beautiful day today, had the windows open.  It's supposed to be just as nice tomorrow.  Can you believe it was around 70* today?  And tomorrow they want them in the 60's.  They were only expecting 60's today and it got warmer so hopefully tomorrow we will see the same.  Mother Nature I applaude thee today!

Hope everyone had a chance to enjoy at least part of today after all the cold weather. 

G'nite.

Your Values Profile
Loyalty: You value loyalty a fair amount. You're loyal to your friends... to a point. But if they cross you, you will reconsider your loyalties. Staying true to others is important to you, but you also stay true to yourself. Honesty: You value honesty a fair amount. You're honest when you can be, but you aren't a stickler for it. If a little white lie will make a situation more comfortable, you'll go for it. In the end, you mostly care about "situational integrity." Generosity: You value generosity a fair amount. You are all about giving, as long as there's some give and take. Supportive and kind, you don't mind helping out a friend in need. But you know when you've given too much. You have no problem saying "no"! Humility: You value humility highly. You have the self-confidence to be happy with who you are. And you don't need to seek praise to make yourself feel better. You're very modest, and you're keep the drama factor low. Tolerance: You value tolerance highly. Not only do you enjoy the company of those very different from you... You do all that you can to seek it out interesting and unique friends. You think there are many truths in life, and you're open to many of them.
The Five Factor Values Test

Well, DJ got an R.S.V.P. today. It makes me wonder if maybe they weren't handed out when I sent them because one time I got an invitation about 3 days before the party. Luckily the date to call by was the day before the party. Anyway, I hope there are a few more and that would make me happy. If not, oh well. She'll have fun anyway and it will be neat to have the whole theatre to ourselves! We'll feel all kinds of special. lol It's horrible to say but I wish I had someone to watch Billy because he isn't going to sit for a movie.....I know no one will though. It's ok, not like I'm not used to having my kids all the time! lolol One good thing, I never push my kids off on anyone. Oh, and if no others call or show (since I know some will show that didn't call which I hate) then I won't have to buy alot of cake, soda and popcorn. yay for us! lol

Also, got a pretty good start on the kitchen. I'd say I cleaned it but I'm doing a thorough job so it takes like 10 times longer and won't be noticed anyway. I found that out today. Yeah well. After the kitchen, the living room. Kinda scared of that one. lol I make it sound bad but it's not so much dirty as it is cluttered and someone wanted to get on a high and mighty horse again the other day so now I'm doing it to the T so that once I'm done I can prove how and when he screws it up. Ass monkey. lol Eventually after the living room, it will be the bathroom then DUN DUN DUN the bedroom. *twitch* lol

I'm going to jam a bit while surfing the net then off to bed. I get to call my sweetie(no not a boyfriend...old friend) tonight if I stay awake long enough...then again in the morning. Hope I can stay awake but I told him not to hold his breath because of my cold and the kids, I've been really tired the past two days. 10 a.m. won't come quick enough though lol

Ok, if anyone wants to volunteer to babysit, or knows of someone coming to the party that forgot to call, let me know. There is a total of 5 kids so far...6 including her....a possible 7th if the weather permits their travel. If you feel spiffy, check out her gift registry at Wal*Mart.com.

Later!

As of today, there are 4 kids coming to DJ's party.  None from school but hey.....less crap I have to buy!  I have a while left to go though till I hit the date for calling so we will see.

I also got in touch with an old friend of mine today....they contacted me actually.  Made my day.  I can't wait to talk to them again.  We have so much to catch up on!

Well that's about all I have to report.

Well, DJ's birthday invitations are out. Now we wait for R.S.V.P.'s so I know how many goody bags to make and how much cake to order. Bratz will be what she has on her cake. Should be a fun party. We'll see.
Like the dork I am, I made her invitations with card stock, stamps and cut outs. They were cute. Also Bratz. I will also be making the thank you cards and name tags for the goodie bags. Yep, that's right, just call me Suzy.
Off to bed now.
Later

Tongight and old friend reminded me of an old phrase I used to say alot and I had completely forgotten about.....I don't know how I could have but because I can I am posting it for my own amusement.....


Cum Guzzling Gutter Slut!  

Don't ask, those who remember where it came from will appreciate it and those who don't...it was a good one. lol

On another note, I found out some very interesting information on someone that just made my night!  Thank you to the revealer!

So school was cancelled today due to the possibility of the weather getting much worse.  Therefore, the children and I are going to be watching movies and staying in our pajamas and stuff.  

DJ's birthday invitations are done!  Started them yesterday, finished them last night.  Was a total of about 4 hours I spend on making them.  Cutting, stamping, pasting, writing...yes I made them!  All 22 of them! Damn I'm good.  lol

That's about it for now.

Everyone be careful if you have to venture out in bad weather.

Lady and the Tramp is being released today for the first time on DVD. Why am I telling you this? Because my kids like disney movies and I am a hopless disney freak myslef and am just as excited and want the movie. They are only releasing it from today till the end of March then they are going to stop selling it. Why? Cause they can and they make more sales by creating a limited time period. So yes, I must aquire that movie. Now that I've wasted about 30 seconds of your life, I'll let you be.

April --
[noun]:

A poltergeist sent back in time to change the course of history forever

'How will you be defined in the dictionary?' at QuizGalaxy.com

About the same time this happened we were in the area....we decided to go through the gap instead of staying on the highway for this reason(going to visit my mother in law in Dillsburg).  We got off the exit before the one where this accident occured.........talk about a lucky day!!
 
http://www.wgal.com/news/7473200/detail.html

Booyaa...I'm back baby!  2 weeks felt like an eternity without the internet considering everyone I talk to and all communications to the outside world are online, I'm to say the least, overly excited to be back online.

<FONT color=#009900>My bank never stops amazing me.  They have now managed to misplace a total of nearly $100 from my account.  $60 of it was of them personally misplacing it somewhere in their bank and the rest is by them letting people take money out of our account without our permission or knowledge!  The best part?  The people who they let take money out, somehow managed to get my account number through my old bank card.  The one I cancelled in November!!  I am PISSED to say the least.  Bu is calling the payroll main office for where he works Monday to stop direct diposit immediately and they can suck my ass.  I already have a second account at another bank so there isn't anything they can do as far as putting my name on whatever kind of list they have that doesn't allow you to get another account at other banks which I know they can do because I know people who can't because of that very reason.  Anyway, screw them and although it isn't much to them, they just lost my business and money.  And, I will be telling everyone I know who is thinking of banking through that particular bank to go else where.  This is not the only account I've had through this bank that got screwed up.  When they changed hands though I thought ok another shot.  I won't make that mistake again!  Live and Learn right?!</FONT>

<FONT color=#33cc00><FONT size=5>Ok, on the 24th I posted info on a car my friend is trying to sell. He has lowered his price to 6,000 if anyone is interested, again......let me know and I will pass on your info and interests to him so he may contact you one way or another. If you missed the post or whatever, go to my January 24th post here on livejournal.</FONT> </FONT>

You Are a Prophet Soul
You are a gentle soul, with good intentions toward everyone. Selfless and kind, you have great faith in people. Sometimes this faith can lead to disappoinment in the long run. No matter what, you deal with everything in a calm and balanced way. You are a good interpreter, very sensitive, intuitive, caring, and gentle. Concerned about the world, you are good at predicting people's feelings. A seeker of wisdom, you are a life long learner looking for purpose and meaning. You are a great thinker and communicator, but not necessarily a doer. Souls you are most compatible with: Bright Star Soul and Dreaming Soul
What Kind of Soul Are You?
What Your Sleeping Position Says
You are calm and rational. You are also giving and kind - a great friend. You are easy going and trusting. However, you are too sensible to fall for mind games.
What Does Your Sleeping Position Say About You?
Snickers
Nutty and gooey - you always satisfy.
What Kind of Candy Are You?
You are Agnostic
You're not sure if God exists, and you don't care. For you, there's no true way to figure out the divine. You rather focus on what you can control - your own life. And you tend to resent when others "sell" religion to you.
What's Your Religious Philosophy?

All drugs containing PHENYLPROPANOLAMINE are being recalled.
You may want to try calling the 800 number listed on most
drug boxes and inquire about a REFUND. Please read this
CAREFULLY. Also, please pass this on to everyone you know.

STOP TAKING anything containing this ingredient. It has been
linked to increased hemorrhagic stroke (bleeding in brain)
among women ages 18-49 in the three days after starting use
of medication. Problems were not found in men, but the FDA
recommended that everyone (even children) seek alternative
medicine.

The following medications contain Phenylpropanolamine:

Acutrim Diet Gum Appetite Suppressant
Acutrim Plus Dietary Supplements
Acutrim Maximum Strength Appetite Control
Alka-Seltzer Plus Children's Cold Medicine Effervescent
Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold medicine (cherry or orange)
Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold Medicine Original
Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold & Cough M edicine Effervescent
Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold & Flu Medicine
Alka-Seltzer Plus Cold & Sinus Effervescent
Alka Seltzer Plus Night-Time Cold Medicine
BC Allergy Sinus Cold Powder
BC Sinus Cold Powder
Comtrex Flu Therapy & Fever Relief
Day & Night Contac 12-Hour Cold Capsules
Contac 12 Hour Caplets
Coricidin D Cold, Flu & Sinus
Dexatrim Caffeine Free
Dexatrim Extended Duration
Dexatrim Gelcaps
Dexatrim Vitamin C/Caffeine Free
Dimetapp Cold & Allergy Chewable Tablets
Dimetapp Cold & Cough Liqui-Gels
Dimetapp DM Cold & Cough Elixir
Dimetapp Elixir
Dimetapp 4 Hour Liquid Gels
Dimetapp 4 Hour Tablets
Dimetapp 12 Hour Extentabs Tablets
Naldecon DX Pediatric Drops
Permathene Mega-16
Robitussin CF
Tavist-D 12 Hour Relief of Sinus & Nasal
Congestion
Triaminic DM Cough Rel! ief
Triaminic Expectorant Chest & Head
Triaminic Syrup Cold & Allergy
Triaminic Triaminicol Cold & Cough .

I just found out and called the 800# on the container
for Triaminic and they informed me that they are voluntarily
recalling the following medicines because of a certain
ingredient that is causing strokes and seizures in children:

Orange 3D Cold & Allergy Cherry (Pink)
3D Cold & Cough Berry
3D Cough Relief Yellow 3D Expectorant

They are asking you to call them at 800-548-3708 with
the lot number on the box so they can send you postage fo r you
to send it back to them, and they will also issue you a
refund. If you know of anyone else with small children,
PLEASE PASS THIS ON. THIS IS SERIOUS STUFF!

DO PASS ALONG TO ALL ON YOUR MAILING LIST so people are
informed. They can then pass it along to their families.

To confirm these findings please take time to check the
following:

http://www.fda.gov/cder/drug/infopage/ppa/

PLEASE PASS THIS ON TO YOUR CHILDREN IN CASE THEY GIVE IT TO THEIR CHILDREN OR TO FRIENDS WHO HAVE CHILDREN AND GRANDCHILDREN

A friend of mine is selling a car.  If your interested, let me know and I will pass your email/username onto him to contact you.



The following is the information provided by my friend on his journal......

Year/Make: 2000 VW New Beetle TDI 
Transmission: Automatic 
Color: Jawbreaker Yellow 
Miles: 110,000 miles 
Engine: 4cylinder diesel engine 
Gas Mileage: 38mpg city/48mpg hwy 

Asking $8,000 for her. Kelly Blue Book has it valued at over $10,000 if you were to buy it in it's current condition from a dealership. It's a good car and while the interior needs some cleaning everything is working fine. Just had about $2,000 worth of work done on it. I'm even throwing in my dual 12" subwoofers and amp that I had installed awhile back. 



Again, let me know here and I will pass any info on that you want me to to the seller.

Welcome to the 2006 edition of getting to know your friends.  Copy this and repost it on your blog with your own answers.  

1. What time did you get up this morning?  7 a.m.

2. Diamonds or Pearls? Pearls

3. What was the last film you saw at the cinema? Ocean's Eleven

4. What are your favorite TV shows?  TAPS, CSI, Nanny 911, Wife Swap, Supernatural.

5. What did you have for breakfast?  Home fries with cheese 

6. What is your middle name?  Lynn

7. What is your favorite cuisine?  Italian 

8. What foods do you dislike? Fish 

9. Your favorite Potato chip?  Salt N Vinegar even though I basically don't eat chips 

10. What is your favorite CD at the moment? Don't have one favorite

11. What kind of car do you drive?  Buick 

12. Favorite sandwich?  Ham and Cheese Club (dry)

13. What characteristics do you despise?   People who act like those they despise for the same thing, back stabbers, selfish people

14. What are your favorite clothes? Sweat pants/lounge pants and a T-Shirt

Your Eyes Should Be Brown
Your eyes reflect: Depth and wisdom What's hidden behind your eyes: A tender heart
What Color Should Your Eyes Be?
You Have a Phlegmatic Temperament
Mild mannered and laid back, you take life at a slow pace. You are very consistent - both in emotions and actions. You tend to absorb set backs easily. You are cool and collected. It is difficult to offend you. You can remain composed and unemotional. You are a great friend and lover. You don't demand much of others. While you are quiet, you have a subtle wit that your friends know well. At your worst, you are lazy and unwilling to work at anything. You often get stuck in a rut, without aspirations or dreams. You can get too dependent on others, setting yourself up for abandonment.
What Temperment Are You?
You Are 29 Years Old
Under 12: You are a kid at heart. You still have an optimistic life view - and you look at the world with awe. 13-19: You are a teenager at heart. You question authority and are still trying to find your place in this world. 20-29: You are a twentysomething at heart. You feel excited about what's to come... love, work, and new experiences. 30-39: You are a thirtysomething at heart. You've had a taste of success and true love, but you want more! 40+: You are a mature adult. You've been through most of the ups and downs of life already. Now you get to sit back and relax.
What Age Do You Act?
You Are Dublin Mudslide Ice Cream
You won't remember any of this in the morning

Well my little boy turned 2 today.  Had a cake and friends over.  Thank you to those who actually came.  I think the total was 6 adults and 4 children.  Not all at once though.  Billy enjoyed it though and likes the new toys he has and that is all that matters.

I'm going to go take some aleve and begin my recovery process, then start plotting DJ's party.

In the morning Bu is supposed to be taking Billy with him to go get some dried fruit at the auction, batteries for Billy's toy and something else I can't remember lol.  We got the pictures.  They are so cute even though the camera was a bit off center.  I guess for $8 I can't complain too much.  Still wish I could have had them on disc.  

Cake is baked, just have to decorate it tomorrow (which is where Bu and Billy's morning out comes in handy) I'll just be using yellow icing and sprinkles.  Take a bath and vaccume, get dressed up for the hordes of people coming....NOT.  But hey, sometimes it just feels good to dress up, especially when you know your man likes it.  I'll even do the makeup thing.

When I was putting Billy's picture in the frame I took out the ones from 2 months and 6 months and laid all three of them side by side.  I can't even begin to let you know how funny it looked.  I thought (and many other's have said the same) that his looks didn't ever change....wow was I wrong.  lol  It was too funny.  

Yes well, time to sleep so I'm not to groggy tomorrow for those coming to see him and whatever.

Tomorrow after Bu gets off work and DJ gets home from school, we are going to walmart. Going to cancel the cake we ordered for Billy probably and instead of spending the $13 we were going to spend on that and spend $3 on toys from the party favor isle for on top of it and I'll bake the confetti cake I have in the cabnet. He doesn't know the difference and besides, I think 2 or 3 people at most are coming. We have to get batteries for the gift we got him, his pictures which are ready (so whoever comes on Saturday and wants one, they will definately be here) and one or two other things we need. One of them being a gallon of tea. lol

As it sits right now, George still didn't get back to me on when he wants to pick up DJ so I have no clue if she will be there Saturday or not, to those who want to come. Also, I pretty much refined the invite from whenever to whenever back to around 1 p.m. till 4 p.m. I think that is a good time span. That way I'm not trying to make dinner while we have company.

Well, gonna go jam some more and ponder what spongebob things to get for on top of his cake. Also have to figure out how to get the extra pictures they always give you the option of buying at walmart when you pick yours up, for cheaper since when they were taken, I couldn't buy the disc like I wanted and now I can't get it cause they're computer was messed up at the time. Plus I'm not paying for extra pics at full price when there weren't even 6 poses taken like they are supposed to.

So, today the superindentant at the school called me back.  He said he found out the reason the nurse was with the Truant Officer when he came to my house.  At first I thought here come the excuses but he surprised me.  He said the officer has had bad problems with some parents and now refuses to go alone.  First off that just gave me reason to make fun of him for being a puss since they are supposed to be able to handle hostility, hell it's the job.  Second and this idea I voiced, why did it have to be her that went with him when it could have been anyone else given the circumstances.  He said he agreed and that she has not only been told never to come to my house again but she is not permitted to go with the officer or anyone else for that matter to anyones home.  That made me a bit happier.  Ok, it made me very happy.

He also said that if she were to ever return to my house for any reason or with anyone no matter who it may be, I am to call him immediately.  That to me says right there that she was way over her boundaries.  He also added that Ms. Bowen felt really bad about how upset I was over it and apologized.  I didn't say ok, but I informed him that if the nurse causes any more problems, there will be more trouble from me, even if it means doing what I have to, to terminate her job.  After I got off the phone I thought....if Ms. Bowen, the principal of the elementary school, felt that bad that I got so upset, why didn't she apologize to me instead of having the superintendant do it?  She isn't sorry, she was just covering her own ass on the matter.  

That's ok, I'm still waiting to hear back from the lawyer to see what he says about the whole thing before I let it alone.  If there is something that can be done, it will be done because I'm still furious at the nurse for having the nerve when she knew she was the cause of the officer being there. 

Also, if I get a fine for her absences, I'm fighting it because Ms. Bowen assured me to my face that when the nurse sends a student home it is considered a medically excused absence and I didn't have to worry about getting one.  Now they are saying they are unexcused and want doctors notes. 

I'll keep you up to date.........

Anyone who knows me, knows how the nurse at DJ's school has been being a huge pain in the ass.  Well DJ has missed quite a few days of school so they sent the Truancy Officer to the door today to inform me that if it continues, we could get fined.  This didn't bother me because I knew that, and I know he personally isn't the one causing any problems.....HOWEVER, when he introduced himself he said he was here with the school nurse.  I poked my head out the door and nearly fell over.  That's right.  The bitch was sitting right there in the car!  Needless to say, I made if very clear that she was not welcome in my house and she can stay right where she is.  

Then I proceeded to explain everything to the truance officer.  After he left, I then called the superintendent of the school.  I told him I know he probably has no clue about anything that has been going on but I know she had NO right to step foot on my property and something had better be done about it.  I of course had to explain everything to him to bring him up to speed and then I repeated myself.  She overstepped her boundaries with me and had no right what so ever to come to my house!  He will be talking to her and calling me back by wednesday to let me know what happened.  

I also called a lawyer and will be hearing from them tomorrow to schedule and appointment to do something cause she is harrassing my daughter and it's gonna stop.  Nothing would have come of this had it not been for the fact that she had the nerve to come to my house.  Wench.  She has no right....she is a mere school nurse, a nobody, no authority to do that!  That's rediculous and it WILL NOT happen again.

Who agrees with me?  How would that make you feel?!  Am I over reacting?  I seriously don't think I am and those who know me know that it takes a lot to get me this fired up.  I was so mad all day I was shaking and my nerves were making my stomach tickle from the anxiety!

My bitch button has been pushed to the point of jamming.

If anyone knows of anyone who needs a babysitter in the area PLEASE give them my name or tell me.  I really need to feel like I'm contributing to the household finances, it's driving me crazy.  Without experience I can't go get a job that pays enough to afford daycare and actually have something left out of a paycheck to bring home.  This is the most important question most likely.... 1.75 per hour.  Full or Part time.  No weekends please.

Much, Much, Much drunk. came over last night and we all got hammered. I realized this morning through my post drunken haze that the phrase "Why's the rum gone" was used many times.......because it fit the moment! I think. It was used many times regardless and at the time it really amuzed us which is all that really mattered. We very much need to do that again...and again, and again, and again. And I'm not saying anymore. I'm rambling and I don't need to say anything else. Whatcha say do it again?

Well, he came, was relatively painless.  As usual, he acted like the past year or so hasn't happened but I won't forget that it did.  I don't care if he is my father, he is a rotten one.  I also don't care if that makes me slip right into the "women that hold grudges for life" catagory.  He doesn't deserve having my kids in his life.  However, DJ is old enough to remember him cause she used to spend tons of time with him until shortly before Billy was born, so I can't do that to her.  In the past year however, she has only seen him 2 times.  Today and once for 2 minutes outside the store.  Oh wait.  I think there were two other breif 2 minute meetings.  Can't remember.  Including today though it only equals to about 2 hours this year.  Nice grandfather eh?

My father is coming today.........I'll let ya know how that went.  Note the lack of enthusiasm in my voice.  He's bringing the christmas gifts for the kids that he has.  Wish he would just go away.  Wish the whole lot of them would.

K, I'll update on that later.

The National Transportation Safety Board recently divulged they had covertly funded a project with the U.S. auto makers for the past 5 years, whereby the auto makers were installing black box voice\data recorders in four-wheel drive pickup trucks and SUV's in an effort to determine, in fatal accidents, the circumstances in the last 15 seconds before the crash.
 
They were surprised to find that in 44 states, the recorded last words of drivers in 61.2 percent of fatal crashes were, "Oh Sh!t!"
 
In the remaining states - Oklahoma, Tennessee, Missouri, Arkansas, Alabama and Texas - 89.3 percent of the final words were: "Hold my beer, I'm gonna try something."
**********************************************************************************************************

The Kitchen Bitch
A mother was working in the kitchen listening to her 5-year-old son
playing with his new electric train in the living room.  She heard the
train stop and her son saying, "All of you sons of  bitches who want off,
get the hell off now... cause this is the last stop! And all of you sons
of bitches who are getting on, get your asses on the train...cause we're
going down the tracks."
The horrified mother went in and told her son, "We don't use that  kind of
language in this house. Now I want you to go to your room and you are to
stay there for TWO HOURS. When you come out, you may play with  your
train...but I want you to use nice language."
Two hours later, the boy came out of the bedroom and resumed playing with
his train. Soon the train stopped and the mother heard her son  say...
"All passengers, please remember your things, thank you and hope your trip
was a pleasant one. We
hope you will ride with us again soon." She heard her little darling
continue..."For those of you just boarding, remember there is no smoking
in the train. We hope you will have a pleasant and relaxing journey with
us today."
As the mother began to smile,
The child added, "For those of you who are pissed off about the TWO HOUR
delay, please see the bitch in the kitchen."

That sounds like something I should be expecting to hear from Billy in 3 years.......if it takes him that long!  After all, look at his father.  Why should I expect anything different?  oy

A man comes into the ER and yells, "My wife's going to have her baby in the cab!" I grabbed my stuff, rushed out to the cab, lifted the lady's dress, and began to take off her underwear. Suddenly I noticed that there 
were several cabs - and I was in the wrong one.

Dr. Mark MacDonald, San Antonio, TX 

***************** 
At the beginning of my shift I placed a stethoscope on an elderly and slightly deaf female patient's anterior chest wall. "Big breaths," I instructed. "Yes, they used to be," remorsed the patient

Dr. Richard Byrnes, Seattle, WA

************************

One day I had to be the bearer of bad news when I told a wife that her husband had died 
of a massive myocardial infarct. Not more than five
minutes later, I heard her reporting to the rest of the family that he had died of a "massive internal fart."

Dr. Susan Steinberg, Manitoba, Canada

******************

I was performing a complete physical, including the visual acuity test. I placed the patient twenty feet from the chart and began, "Cover your right eye with your hand." He read the 20/20 line perfectly. "Now your left." Again, 
a flawless read. "Now both," I requested. There was silence. He couldn't even read the large 
E on the top line. I turned and discovered that he had done exactly what I had asked; he was standing there with both his eyes covered. I was laughing too hard to finish the exam.

Dr. Matthew Theodropolous, Worcester, MA

******************** 

During a patient's two week follow-up appointment with his cardiologist, he informed me, his doctor, that he was having trouble with one of his medications. "Which one?" I asked. "The patch. The nurse told me to put on a new one every six hours and now I'm running out of places to put it!" I had him quickly undress and discovered what I hoped I wouldn't see Yes, the man had over fifty patches on his body! Now, the instructions include removal of the 
old patch before applying a new one.

Dr. Rebecca St. Clair, Norfolk, VA 

*******************

While acquainting myself with a new elderly patient, I asked, "How long have you been bedridden?" After a look of complete confusion she answered... "Why, not for about twenty years -when my husband was
alive."

Dr. Steven Swanson, Corvallis, OR


******************

I was caring for a woman and asked, "So how's your breakfast this morning?" "It's very good, except for the Kentucky Jelly. I can't seem to get used to the taste" the patient replied. I then asked to see the jelly and the woman produced a foil packet labeled "KY Jelly."

Dr. Leonard Kransdorf, Detroit, MI 

*****************

A nurse was on duty in the Emergency Room, when a young woman with purple hair styled 
into a punk rocker Mohawk, sporting a variety of tattoos, and wearing strange clothing, entered. It was quickly determined that the patient had acute appendicitis, so she was scheduled for immediate surgery. When she 
was completely disrobed on the operating 
table, the staff noticed that her pubic hair 
had been dyed green, and above it there was 
a tattoo that read, "Keep off the grass." Once the surgery was completed, the surgeon wrote 
a short note on the patient's dressing, which said, "Sorry, had to mow the lawn."


********************
and finally...
A new, young MD doing his residency in OB 
was quite embarrassed performing female 
pelvic exams. To cover his embarrassment 
he had unconsciously formed a habit of whistling softly. The middle-aged lady upon whom he was performing this exam suddenly burst out laughing and further embarrassed 
him. He looked up from his work and sheepishly said, "I'm sorry. Was I tickling you?" She replied, "No doctor, but the song you were whistling was, "I wish I was an Oscar Meyer Wiener".

Dr. wouldn't admit his name 
**********************************************************************************************************
